name: FetchProjectTaskTemplates
description:
Retrieve compact task template records for a specific project.

Call this tool to obtain a list of compact task template records from Asana for a given project. This can be useful when you need to view or manage task templates associated with a particular project scope.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Number of task templates to return per page, between 1 and 100.

value_schema.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

parameters.name: pagination_offset_token
parameters.description: Offset token for pagination, returned by the API. Use to request the next page of results.

value_schema.description:
Offset token.
An offset to the next page returned by the API. A pagination request will return an offset token, which can be used as an input parameter to the next request. If an offset is not passed in, the API will return the first page of results.
*Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.*

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the project to filter task templates.

value_schema.description: The project to filter task templates on.

parameters.name: optional_fields_to_include
parameters.description: A list of property names to include in the response. Specify the properties you wish to see for the task templates.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Enable this to receive the response in a readable format with proper indentation. Useful for debugging, but increases response time and size.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.
